title: Savchenko Solutions
subtitle: Solutions of Savchenko Problems in Physics

description.intro: The collection of problems in physics edited by O.Y. Savchenko is one of the most popular resources for preparation for physics olympiads in post-soviet countries. Some of these problems were a source of inspiration for Jaan Kalda’s handouts and to some NBPhO problems. You may find problems from old IPhO papers. For more than 30 years since its first edition, not a single complete guide to solving problems from it has been created.
description.project: On this website, you can observe a non-profit startup creating the first wizard of this collection with the design of solutions of
description.moto: In total, 745 solutions have been published, out of 2,023 problems. In 2023, the project was launched, which is actively developing in Russian and English. If you'd like to contribute, feel free to email

popup.title: Enter the name of the problem

meta.keywords: Savchenko Problems in Physics, Savchenko solutions, physics problems, physics olympiad preparation, IPhO, Jaan Kalda
meta.description: The largest dataset of solutions of Savchenko Problems in Physics - widely used to prepare for olympiads and it is a useful tool to master and sharpen your skills and techniques in comptetitive problem solving. Some of these problems were a source of inspiration for Jaan Kalda's handouts and to some NBPhO problems. You may find problems from old IPhO papers.
meta.author: Aliaksandr Melnichenka
meta.ogDescription: A website with solutions to physics problems from Savchenko Textbook

eligibility.title: Eligibility Criteria
eligibility.content: Our collaborative project is dedicated to helping physics students tackle problems from the Savchenko O.Y. textbook. We welcome contributions from everyone, regardless of awards, degrees, or other credentials. Knowledge is for everyone, and together we can make it more accessible!

howToContribute.title: How to Contribute
howToContribute.intro: You can contribute in two simple ways:

edit.title: Edit the Page Directly
edit.content: Every solution page includes an Edit button, allowing you to modify or enhance the content directly. Jump in and share your expertise!

email.title: Email Your Contributions
email.content: Prefer a personal touch? You can email your solutions, suggestions, or helpful ideas to

howToContribute.valueStatement: We value all forms of input and collaboration, big or small.

registration.title: Is Registration Required to Contribute?
registration.content: No! Unregistered users can still share their insights and improve our repository. However, registration unlocks additional features:
benefits: Your name will be displayed alongside other contributors on the solutions you edit.
You'll gain access to advanced tools to make your contributions even more impactful.
registration.conclusion: Your ideas matter—whether you choose to register or not, your voice can help make physics learning better for everyone!
